thread.title: Get your freak on at Key West's Fantasy Fest
thread.title_full: Get your freak on at Key West's Fantasy Fest

author: Adrienne Cutway
title: Get your freak on at Key West's Fantasy Fest
text:
Travel Get your freak on at Key West's Fantasy Fest 
Loud, lurid Fantasy Fest is the annual 10-day masking and costuming celebration in Key West. The 2015 festivities conclude on Nov. 1. Adrienne Cutway Contact Reporter Orlando Sentinel Get your freak on at Fantasy Fest 2015 
Fantasy Fest returns to Key West for 10 days this year, and with an "All Hallows Intergalactic Freak Show" theme, revelers can expect to be immersed in the bizarre and peculiar. 
If you're wondering what kind of ensemble is suited for such an affair, draw your inspiration from paganism, circus sideshows, extraterrestrials, sci-fi or horror classics. These same motifs will be applied to the custom-designed floats, costumes and more during the festival’s spate of masquerades, costume contests and parties. 
A king and queen who will preside over the celebrations will be crowned when the festivities kick off at the Royal Coronation Ball on Friday, Oct. 23. The festival reaches its peak on Halloween with a grand parade where the most creative and extravagant costumes and floats will be rewarded. 
This year's grand marshal is Cindy Williams, known for her role as Shirley Feeney on the classic TV series “Laverne & Shirley.” While that may be her most notable role, Fantasy Fest organizers like to point out her role in the 1983 space horror comedy musical “The Creature Wasn't Nice” alongside Leslie Nielsen that makes her a perfect fit for this year's freak show Fantasy Fest theme. 
“I'm really looking forward to the spirit and camaraderie of the festival,” Williams said in a press release. “Every time I think [of] it, in my head I just see all these colors and everybody's imagination at work and all their costuming -- all that inventiveness and creativity and fun.” 
Between the kickoff ball and the grand parade visitors can expect “Star Wars”-themed burlesque performances, a pet parade, a toga party and other more risqué events. 
Below is a list of events happening during Fantasy Fest, you can also visit FantasyFest.com for more information. 
Below is a list of events happening during Fantasy Fest, you can also visit FantasyFest.com for more information. 
Oct. 23: Royal Coronation Ball at Southernmost Beach Café. Begins at 6 p.m. VIP tickets are $60 each or a $10 donation for standing room only. 1405 Duval Street. 
Oct. 23-24: Goombay Festival in Bahama Village. Noon to midnight. Free. 400 Petronia Street. 
Oct. 23- 27: “The Sexy Side of Star Wars” burlesque show at Waterfront Playhouse. Doors open at 7:30 p.m., show starts at 8 p.m. Tickets range from $45-$75. 310 Wall Street. 
Oct. 26: Heroes and Villains Run/Walk 5K. Begins at Southernmost Beach Cafe at 6 p.m. 1405 Duval Street. 
Oct. 26: Southernmost Post Heroes and Villains Race Luau at Southernmost Beach Cafe. Begins at 6:30 p.m. $35 per person, includes one drink. 1405 Duval Street. 
Oct. 27: Official Fantasy Fest Poster Signing Party at WineO in La Concha Hotel & Spa. Begins at 5 p.m. 430 Duval Street. 
Oct. 27: Cocktails for Animal Tails at Rick’s 8 Famous Bars. 7 p.m. to 10 p.m. $30 for all you can drink. 202 Duval Street. 
Oct. 27: Captain Tony's Party in Plaid at Captain Tony’s Saloon. Begins at 8 p.m. Free. 428 Greene Street. 
Oct. 27: Men of LaBare Tighty Whitey Party at Bare Assets. Begins at 8 p.m. Tickets are $40-$80. 1029 Truman Avenue. 
Oct. 28: Rock and Roll Revitalizing 1960s Pool Party at The Marker Waterfront Resort. 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. 200 William Street. 
Oct. 28: Pet Masquerade at Casa Marina Resort. Registration begins at 4 p.m., show starts at 5:30 p.m. Free to watch. 1500 Reynolds Street. 
Oct. 28: "Smokin’ Hot Tuna" contest at the Smokin' Tuna Saloon. Contest begins at 7 p.m. $50 for a VIP ticket. 4 Charles Street. 
Oct. 28: Dining, Drinking and Drag in the 1920s at Aqua Nightclub. Cocktails will be served starting at 7 p.m., dinner and entertainment begins at 8 p.m. Tickets are $125 - $175. 711 Duval Street. 
Oct. 28: Lazy Gecko Redneck Party at Lazy Gecko. Starts at 7 p.m. Free cover. 203 Duval Street. 
Oct. 28: Wharfstock at the Schooner Wharf Bar. Starts at 7 p.m. Free cover. 202 William Street. 
Oct. 28: Fantasy Fest Burlesque Performance Contest at Sunset Pier. VIP tickets start at $100. 0 Duval Street. 
Oct. 28: Womankind's Brazaar at the Studios of Key West. 8 p.m. to 10 p.m. $30 per ticket. 533 Eaton Street. 
Oct. 28: Annual Luv2Glow Party at Rumor Lounge. Begins at 9 p.m. 430 Greene Street. 
Oct. 28: Dungeon of Dark Secrets and Fetishes at 801 Bourbon Bar. Begins at 9 p.m. $50 for general admission, $100 for VIP. 801 Duval Street. 
Oct. 28: ABC Party at Bare Assets. Begins at 10 p.m. $25 for regular admission. 1029 Truman Avenue. 
Oct. 29: Dante's 9th Annual Halos and Horns Pool Party and Wet T-Shirt Contest at Dante's Restaurant & Raw Bar. Starts at noon. 951 Caroline Street. 
Oct. 29: 33rd Annual Headdress Ball at the Truman Waterfront. Begins at 8 p.m. $30 for regular admission. 201 Front Street. 
Oct. 29: Blackout Glow Party at Coyote Ugly. Sign up begins at 8 p.m., judging at 10 p.m. 218 Duval Street. 
Oct. 29: Sloppy Joe's 32nd Annual Toga Party. Begins at 8 p.m. Cover. 201 Duval Street. 
Oct. 29: The Original Homemade Bikini Contest at Sunset Pier. Doors open at 8 p.m. Free. 0 Duval Street. 
Oct. 29: Margaritaville at Duval Street. Starts at 8 p.m. 500 Duval Street. 
Oct. 29: Exposed at the Bourbon Street Pub Adult Entertainment Complex. 9 p.m. to 4 p.m. 724 Duval Street. 
Oct. 29: Fat Tuesday Pink Party. Starts at 9 p.m. 305 Duval Street. 
Oct. 29: Pajama and Lingerie Party at BottleCap Lounge. Starts at 10 p.m. $25 for regular admission, $50 VIP. 1128 Simonton Street. 
Oct. 29: Irish Kevin's Annual '80s Party. 211C Duval Street. 
Oct. 30: Fantasy Fest Street Fair. Noon to 10 p.m. on Duval Street. 
Oct. 30: Bourbon Street Pub Tea Dance. Starts at 1 p.m. Free. 724 Duval Street/801 Duval Street. 
Oct. 30: Southernmost Intergalactic Circus Costume Contest at the Southernmost Beach Resort. 4 p.m. to 6 p.m. Free. 508 South Street. 
Oct. 30: Masquerade March through Old Town. Begins at the Key West Cemetery Frances Street entrance. Starts at 5 p.m. Free. 701 Passover Lane. 
Oct. 30: Rum Barrel's 9th Annual Pirate Bash. Doors open at 7 p.m., contest at 9 p.m. $10. 528 Front Street. 
Oct. 30: Turtles on the Half Shell at Key West Bight’s Historical Seaport Marina. Doors open at 7 p.m., costume contest at 9 p.m. No cover charge. 201 William Street. 
Oct. 30: 15th Annual Living Art Airbrush Expo at the Sunset Pier. Doors open at 8 p.m. Free. 0 Duval Street. 
Oct. 30: Boxers or Briefs Blacklight Party at the Island House for Men. Doors open at 10 p.m. Tickets are $25. 1129 Fleming Street. 
Oct. 30: Pimp and Ho Party at BottleCap Lounge. Starts at 10 p.m. $35 for a regular ticket. 1128 Simonton Street. 
Oct. 31: Celebrations at Duval Street Promenade. Noon to 10:30 p.m. Free. 
Oct. 31: 3Wishes.com Fantasy Fest Parade. Begins at 7 p.m. Free. Parade starts at Duval Street. 
Oct. 31: Parade Night Party at Rooftop Café. Doors open at 5:30 p.m. $200 per person. 308 Front Street. 
Oct. 31: Parade viewing at the Hard Rock Café. VIP tickets available. 313 Duval Street. 
Oct. 31: Chicago's Annual Gangsters and Molls Party. Starts at 10 p.m. No cover. 610 Greene Street. 
Oct. 31: Dirty Doctor's and Naughty Nurses Party at Mangoes. Starts at 10 p.m. Regular tickets $25. 700 Duval Street. 
Oct. 31: Kinky Couples Party at 801 Bourbon Bar. 10 p.m. to 4 p.m. $250 per couple. 801 Duval Street. 
Nov. 1: Children's Day at Bayview Park. Noon to 5 p.m. On Truman Avenue and Eisenhower Drive. 
Nov. 1: The Fat Lady Sings Tea Dance at La Te Da. 4 p.m. to 8 p.m. $5 cover. 1125 Duval Street.
